topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5423aeab6368720ffdbf0100#post_5423aeab6368720ffdbf0100

That's a nice gesture. :) I do enjoy it when my grandma cooks for the family. A lot of times, it happens on Thanksgiving. Though in recent years my mom has helped.
topics.author: 5056c9e87f123b37f6012a34

topics.body:
"@Bryon":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5423af5063687210d8080000#post_5423af5063687210d8080000
I was forced to help. I got there early so she looks at me and says "put on an apron and help me chop these."
Needless to say I put on the apron and helped.

After dinner was done we all sat around drinking and chatting.
Grandma asked what happened to that "nice boy I was dating." I told her he was cheating on me and she looks at me with a straight face and asks "Did you break his kneecaps yet."
